newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Korea Flour seeks 33,800 tonnes of U.S. wheat.
newsitem.headline: Korea Flour seeks 33,800 tonnes of U.S. wheat.

text.p: South Korea's Korea Flour Milling Corp invited tenders to buy 33,800 tonnes of U.S. No.1 wheat by 2:00 p.m. (0500 GMT) on Tuesday, traders said.

Traders said the tenders were split into two lots: shipment of the first 16,900 tonnes was slated for August 5-September 5 and the remaining 16,900 tonnes for September 1-30 from the Pacific Northwest to South Korea's southwestern port of Mokpo.

They said the company is seeking for 10,100 tonnes of soft white wheat (minimum protein 10.0 percent), 5,200 tonnes of soft white (maximum protein 9.5 percent), 8,900 tonnes of hard red winter (HRW), and 9,600 tonnes of dark northern spring (DNS) or northern spring (NS).
